org.jcvlib.core

Class Image

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvlib.core.Image

  • public class Image
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class for all images that used into the JcvLib.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Image(int width, int height, int numOfChannels)
      Create new empty image.

      • set

        public void set(int x,
                int y,
                int channel,
                int value)
        Set integer value in interval [0, 255] to selected channel from selected pixel.

        If value less minimal or great than maximal allowed value it will be truncated to corresponded correct value. For example value -1 will be replaced to 0, value 256 will be replaced to 255.

      • get

        public int get(int x,
               int y,
               int channel,
               Extrapolation extrapolation)
        Extrapolate image uses selected extrapolation type. Uses into filters.
        Parameters:
        x - X-position.
        y - Y-position.
        channel - Number of channel.
        extrapolation - Extrapolation method.
        Returns:
        Values of color from current image using extrapolation. It means, that you can using negative values of x and y or values more than width and height.

      • get

        public double get(double x,
                  double y,
                  int channel,
                  Interpolation interpolation)
        Interpolate image uses selected interpolation type. Uses into geometry transformations.
        Parameters:
        x - X-position.
        y - Y-position.
        channel - Number of channel.
        interpolation - Interpolation method.
        Returns:
        Values of color from current image using interpolation. It means, that you can using fractional pixel position values of x and y result will be interpolate.

      • foreach

        public void foreach(ParallelValueOperation runner)

      • noneLinearFilter

        public void noneLinearFilter(Image result,
                             int width,
                             int height,
                             Point anchor,
                             Extrapolation extrapolation,
                             KernelOperation operator)

      • noneLinearFilter

        public void noneLinearFilter(Image result,
                             int width,
                             int height,
                             Point anchor,
                             int iterations,
                             Extrapolation extrapolation,
                             KernelOperation operator)
        Nonlinear filter.

        For each pixel on this image apply given operator. This operator get kernel values and put result into current pixel. For example, we have kernel size [4 x 4] and anchor (1, 1) for each pixel on image we select a field: 

             0 1 2 3
   +---------+
 0 | o o o o |
 1 | o x o o |
 2 | o o o o |
 3 | o o o o |
   +---------+
        And put this values into operator. Result of this operator set to current pixel.

        Some filters need kernel with only odd sizes and anchor only in the center (for example, Gaussian blur).

        Links:
        1. Nonlinear filter -- Wikipedia.

        Parameters:
        result - Result image.
        width - Width of kernel that will be used for image operation.
        height - Height of kernel that will be used for image operation.
        anchor - Anchor of the kernel that contain the relative position of a filtered point within the kernel.
        iterations - Number of iteration this filter to source image.
        extrapolation - Extrapolation method.
        operator - Operation that should get kernel on each step.

      • fill

        public void fill(Color color)
        Fill current image by given color (each pixel will be have defined color).

      • mult

        public void mult(double c)
        This method multiply current image on given number.

        If value of color will be more than Color.MAX_VALUE this color value set Color.MAX_VALUE. If value of color will be less than Color.MIN_VALUE this color value set Color.MIN_VALUE.

      • convolve

        public double[] convolve(Jama.Matrix kernel)
        Convolve current image with given matrix.

        Links:
        1. Convolution -- Wikipedia.

        Returns:
        Result of convolution for each channel.

      • makeSame

        public Image makeSame()
        Create empty image with size, number of channels and source type as in given image.

        Values from given image will be not copied!

      • copyTo

        public void copyTo(Image target)
        Copy values from current to given image. Given image should have SAME size as current image.

      • makeCopy

        public Image makeCopy()
        Return copy of current image. It will be a REAL COPY of current image or sub-image!

      • makeSubImage

        public Image makeSubImage(int x,
                          int y,
                          int width,
                          int height)
        Return sub-image based on current source. It is NOT COPY current image.

      • makeLayer

        public Image makeLayer(int startChannel,
                       int sizeLayer)
        Select from multichannel image from current image.

        Returned image will be have same size but this new image contains only sizeLayer channels that got from startChannel to startChannel + sizeLayer. It is NOT COPY of current image -- this is SAME channels from current image!

      • makeChannel

        public Image makeChannel(int numChannel)
        Select single channel image based on channel with number channelNumber from current multichannel image.

        This is analog of split function from other computer vision libraries. You can get access to channels as an elements of a list. It is NOT COPY current image -- this is SAME channel from image!

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
        Return true if current image equivalent to object from parameter and false otherwise.

        Uses JCV.PRECISION by default.

        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return string with some internal information about this channel.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
